title.value: Extended Lyman-α emission towards the SPT2349-56 protocluster at z = 4.3
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as given at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Extended Lyman-α emission towards the SPT2349-56 protocluster at z = 4.3

extractions.description: This paper presents a deep spectroscopic survey using MUSE at the VLT to study Lyman-α emission in the SPT2349-56 protocluster system at redshift z = 4.3. The study reveals a few Lyman-α emitters and an extended Lyman-α structure that could be fueled by dusty star-forming galaxies.

type.justification: The paper involves observational data analysis from instruments like MUSE and ALMA.
type.quote: We conducted a deep Lyman-α line emission survey around SPT2349-56 using the Multi-Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) at Very Large Telescope (VLT) in order to characterize this uniquely dense environment.

name.justification: The paper discusses Lyman-α emission in a protocluster, which is a key area of research in Astronomy & Astrophysics.
name.quote: Observations with MUSE at the VLT UT4 were performed in two separate pointings targeting the north and south extensions of the SPT2349-56 protocluster system (Figure 1).

name.justification: The paper explores the formation and evolution of galaxies in the early universe through the study of Lyman-α emissions in a high-redshift protocluster.
name.quote: Studies of massive galaxies at the peak of their star-formation activity and their relation to the densest protocluster systems are key to understanding the hierarchical formation of the most massive galaxy structures in the early Universe.

name.justification: The research involves the study of structures in the early Universe, which is a significant aspect of cosmology.
name.quote: These cosmological simulations indicate that galaxies within galaxy protoclusters experience a luminous starburst-phase (Miley & De Breuck 2008).

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of the MUSE Python Data Analysis Framework for data reduction.
name.quote: We combined the five OB data cubes per field using the MUSE Python Data Analysis Framework (MPDAF; Bacon et al. 2016).

referenced_paper_title.value: The MUSE Data Reduction Pipeline: Status after Preliminary Acceptance Europe
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the paper referenced for MPDAF in the research paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We combined the five OB data cubes per field using the MUSE Python Data Analysis Framework (MPDAF; Bacon et al. 2016).
